However the digital currency here can mean currency pairs, most cases crypto  we can also invest in physical asset but what we are concerned  here  is simply Digital currency Now let's choose  For me  I will just go with Forex trading and my reasons is thisLearning  Forex gives you the foundational level and knowledge to Investment,when  you learn Forex you can predict what to invest on,which gives you two additional knowledge  at a time.However, you might be in support or the other way round or might have anything to add or correct,all welcomed let's here your choice

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: First of all, trading is not for everyone. To become a trader, you will need to learn about it. With knowledge and experience you can become a better trader. But the chance that a person will not become a successful trader is higher than for the person to become a better trader. This is because some people will go the wrong way or be doing one thing or the other that will be resulting to losses. There are certain things to be considered before trading, you have to know about how to manage your risks and how to trade in a way that you will overcome emotion.Investment is also good, but it depend on what you want to invest on. If you invested on a shitcoin that became dead, your money is gone. Before you invest, you need to make research about it and know how risky what you are investing on is. If you buy a land, or you are investing on real estate, or you buy bitcoin after a massive bear market. All these can be a good investment. If trading is considered as gambling, some investments are also like gambling.If you invest on less risky assets, it will take less energy from you, you do not have to panic of liquidation after little unrealized loss, you do not have to keep tracking your positions in the derivative market. In this regard, trading is riskier, but that does not still mean that you cannot trade if you learn about it very well and have a good experience already. In my opinion, assuming I am having $1000, I can use $10 to learn how to trade, $100 for trading, and the rest to investment on less risky assets.

To me, what distinguishes them is the risk involved in them in relation with the process of learning them. To be FX trader, the risk is high when you don’t have any knowledge about it but can be predicted with sufficient knowledge and practice on the market trends overtime. If I am going into investment, which is solely buying and holding, I don’t need to learn much about the market to know the better investment to go into, I just need to buy and hold overtime and wait for my money to increase. The risk here is high and can easily get you bankrupt as we can’t predict the market movement unlike FX that can be determined through learning overtime. In some cases, investment can be researched and analyzed before going into them, but the tendency of them going sideways is still higher than that of FX. The end point is that, they are both risky, but one can be controlled through extensive learning.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: There is a very thin line between trading and investment based on your definition of the later. I will try to paraphrase your statement to be able to give me perspective on this topic. Investment like I know it is not limited to digital assets as trading itself is another form of investment... you invest time, resources and even money in order to make more money. Investment in the form of buying and holding digital assets such as Bitcoin is a wonderful approach that have proven to be very profitable but requires a lot of patience and discipline to be able to hold amidst the temptation to sell when in profit or fidget when in loss. Trading on the other hand have higher risk and higher returns.  High risk because it requires very delicate skill and discipline to scale through. But when the skill is mastered, trading is far more lucrative than anything you can imagine. Most big holders of Bitcoin I know are people who made money from trading and decided to invest in Bitcoin. So, I am of the opinion that both trading and investment are good and better combined for both short term and long term profitability.
